description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b19a1","text":"Carbon-based materials play significant roles in the development of material science. Carbon dots (CDs), a new rising star in the carbon family. Carbon dots (C-dots) have gained more attention among researchers due to their outstanding fluorescent property which can be tuned based on several factors like high photostability, excellent water solubility, tunable fluorescence and optical properties, high quantum yield (QY), low toxicity, good biocompatibility, and environmental friendliness. One among them is based on a carbon source, so scientists have widely investigated several synthetic and natural materials to produce C-dots for diverse applications. Among these approaches, hydrothermal/carbonization treatment is frequently applied for the preparation CDs because of the outstanding advantages, such as high yield, simple manipulation, easy control, uniform products, lower air pollution, low energy consumption and so on. In this protocol we intend to use the sweet basil, scientifically known as Ocimum basilicum leaves as a precursor to produce C-dots using water as a solvent by adopting the hydrothermal methodology. The green synthesis methods by means of green precursors of synthesis involves the usage of inexpensive or recycled materials, while the chemical synthesis methods involve toxic chemical reagents or organic solvents as precursors. The synthesized C-dots have been confirmed by their fluorescent image and UV-Visible spectrometer. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1010,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2llai","text":"After the process, the reactor is allowed to be cooled down naturally inside the oven.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2557v","text":"After completing the step 3, the resulting black turbid solution is transferred to the centrifuge tubes and C-dots are collected.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bghb1","text":"The solution is purified by centrifugation with  for   .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fl73l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"± 00:05:00","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6391o","text":"Discard the pellet which is burnt residue of leaf powder, and the brownish solution is collected without disturbing the pellet at the bottom.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jgg2","text":"Later, to obtain pure C-dots the solution is centrifuged at   for  at  .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"crd59","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"13000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"± 00:02:00","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"± 1 °C","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"8","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj217","text":"The solution collected from (step 4-19) is passed through 0.22 µm pore size nylon sterile syringe filters.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rbjs","text":"The final solution is preserved at   for further use. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"brv2g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6bahb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edobe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"± 1 °C","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6330l","text":"Solution is stable for 8-10 months without contamination.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3h9b","text":"Qualitative testing 1 - The formation can be checked primarily by exposing the solution under the UV light to visualize the blue fluorescence. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0cdp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3mce","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6u4na","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7l9ee","text":"Dilution factor is proportional to the fluorescence intensity but not applicable for all C-dots.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
